column4: anyone know how to save flash videos in ubuntu (gflash program doesn't work to save them)?
ffffffff: this assumes i want to download flash, i have the swf, but i need to get the flv file, any suggestions?
when you say flv, are you referring to youtube vids?
I missed your issue; would you care to repeat it
i have a swf file i downloaded from a private website and i need to download the flv to my hard disk; any ubuntu app to help me (gnash doesn't read it)?
to download or to play the swf or both
not much out there in ubuntu to help huh?
if you can watch it, you can get it from your cache
i don't want propietary adobe flash to view it; there must be another option to get the flv
if you don't know i can continue asking in here
not much experience with gnash, only adobe flash; perhaps someone else knows the answer
